mobs.long_desc: A fresh-faced trainee saunters past you, looking for a fight.
mobs.desc: This lad obviously took all the recruiting officers in Ickle seriously. He's very young, so young that his muscles aren't quite fully developed, but that doesn't seem to faze him in the least. He's ready for a fight -- one with you, in particular.

mobs.long_desc: A regal woman looks up as you enter her chambers.
mobs.desc: You have finally found Commander Thraja, the leader of this training camp. She's very beautiful, in the way that a deadly, sharp sword is very beautiful, and seems about as lethal. She's moving a bit sluggishly, though. Perhaps you just woke her up.

mobs.keywords: wounded-amazon amazon wounded mercenary woman wounded-woman
mobs.long_desc: A wounded mercenary woman looks up in anger as you intrude.
mobs.desc: This is one woman who doesn't need your sympathy or your assistance!  From the top of her mohawk-cut hair to her intimidatingly solid build to her steel-toed boots, she strikes quite an imposing figure. But wounds and scars and gashes cover her body, splitting open her armor. Her reactions are clearly slower than you'd expect of such a strong woman. Perhaps her wounds are slowing her down.

mobs.long_desc: A bedraggled dog begs for scraps here.
mobs.desc: This dog's been kicked one too many times. It's not a bad looking dog;  its mattered, frowzy fur looks like some shade of brown, and its eyes are bright enough-- but its ribs are showing unmercifully. It whines at you, tearing at your heartstrings.

mobs.long_desc: A grey rat skitters away at your approach.
mobs.desc: Anywhere with soldiers and tents will also have rats. This rat is just your average, everyday rat, though instead of being brown or black, it's a nice grey color. You suppose it blends in better with the snow. Its teeth look pretty threatening!

mobs.long_desc: A large white bird swoops down on you, thinking you're prey!
mobs.desc: What a strange bird this is! It's the size of a regular crow, but it's pure white, except for its beak, which is standard yellow,long, and wickedly sharp. It beats you back with its wings, pecking at you ruthlessly.

mobs.long_desc: A sleek black cat is grooming itself vainly here.
mobs.desc: You resist an impulse to pat this cat on its head. Though it's an elegant, sleek, soft-seeming black cat, you know its pure white teeth are amazingly sharp, and that its claws could shred you to ribbons, as much smaller than you as the small feline is.

mobs.long_desc: A chittering shadow with teeth shies away from you, giggling nervously.
mobs.desc: Your skin crawls as you look at this thing! It looks magical, obscenely so. It's not large, about the size of a dog, with long, sharp fingernails and long, sharp teeth. Where did it come from? Why is it here, in this compound?

mobs.long_desc: A horrible creature, covered in thick blood, grins up at you.
mobs.desc: The blood-dread! The Necromancer must have conjured it right before he left the compound or was killed or wherever he is now. It's a humpbacked beast, though you can't make out much more of its shape-- it's drenched in thick, stinking, coagulating blood. You don't know if the blood is the dread's, or something else's.... The only thing you can see for certain is its incredibly long, sharp, glittering white teeth.

mobs.long_desc: A black carrion bird caws in indignation as you approach.
mobs.desc: The bird before you seems somehow tainted. Perhaps it's its obvious relish of dead flesh-- it stinks of death. Its feathers, slick black, are greasy, as if this bird didn't clean itself often.

mobs.long_desc: An orange alley cat stares at you meaningfully.
mobs.desc: Most cats of your acquaintance have been soft, cuddly, and mischevious. Not so, this cat. It's tough-looking, a veteran of the camp it calls home. It's covered with scars; its ears are nocked here and there, testament to some old fight or another. Its ribs show through its draggled, though thick, coat of orange-and-white stripes.

mobs.long_desc: The biggest mosquito you have ever seen is flying here!
mobs.desc: You've heard that in the frozen northlands, mosquitos get big enough to carry off small children. This one seems about that big. You're horrified! It's got to be the length of your arm. Its proboscis is intimidatingly large. You can even hear the hum of its wings as it flies too near to you.

objects.ground: You see a tattered pile of fur here.

extras.text: The cloak is heavy and looks very warm, except for some ripped spots. The holes might have come from some sharp object, and though it's been carefully cleaned, probably by some freezing soldier, you can see the remains of bloodstains around the holes' edges. You consider wearing it yourself, since it still looks somewhat servicable.

objects.ground: A brilliantly-colored woven tapestry rests here, rolled up and obviously forgotten.

extras.text: As you look at the tapestry, your spirit rises from the sublime colors and expert weaving of the piece, then falls, as you notice how ragged its edges are, and how obviously neglected it is.  There's no way it can be repaired, you see.  That's too bad.  If it were in better shape, it'd be worthy of a lord's castle.  You might even want to put it in yours, if you ever get one.

objects.ground: A huge, beat-up tin rainbarrel stands near the fire.

extras.text: It's a lot bigger than a normal barrel. It seems to have the sole function of collecting snow and melting it for drinking. The fire nearby seems to facilitate the melting. It's made of cheap, thrown-together tin. You have no idea how it even holds liquid. There's an inscription on its side.
It reads: "Copyright Sirestis Engineering, courtesy of Artemis, 1996".

objects.ground: A pair of long wooden snowshoes rest on the ground here.

extras.text: The long wooden oval frames support your feet on interlaced thongs, and strap on by way of leather buckles.  They don't look very impressive, but they sure do look effective in helping you traverse the killingly cold snow of the arctic fields -- and they might protect you a little bit too.

objects.ground: A broken dragon's fist mace lies here awaiting repair.

extras.text: You've heard stories about this weapon, barely whispered stories told by warriors who were lucky to escape alive from the Dragon Cult, located far from here.  It's made of something that looks like steel, but is much lighter, lucky for you!  The end of the mace is shaped like a dragon's slightly clenched clawed forefoot.  But it's fallen on hard times--its handle is broken, and its surface chipped slightly, affecting its heft and balance.  It's still quite usable, though no experienced warrior would be interested in wielding it, since its power is greatly reduced because of its condition.  But a junior trainee would be thrilled to have this once-impressive weapon.

objects.ground: A closed book lies on the ground here.

extras.text: The book is leatherbound, and masterfully made, with thick paper pages. Written there, in flowing, well-trained script, you read: Day 22, Month of the Winter Wolf My men go out today to battle the Frost Elves across the mountains. I do not know how to prepare my troops. Yesterday, Lady Rill sent her Amazons to assist me in Queen Serazais' mad quest, but I do not know if even they will make much difference in this fight. We are outnumbered. That obscene little man Serazais sent me, that outlander necromancer, last night cast a spell he said would protect us, but I don't believe it'll work. Ah!-- I hear the war-trumpets. Pray to whatever gods you pray to that at least some of us will return alive, my dearest Thraja. This is the last entry in the book. You see no further entries in the beautifully crafted journal.

objects.ground: A practice blade leans against a wall.

extras.text: This blade has obviously seen better times.  Its edge has dozens of little nicks and imperfections in it.  The handle is wrapped in cheap strips of leather; numerous sweat stains cover it.

objects.ground: A large snow shovel stands against a wall.

extras.text: This snow shovel has a long wooden handle and a shallow, wide scoop, making it ideal for clearing the ground of snow.  In a pinch, one could also use this piece of groundskeeping equipment as a weapon -- that scoop would really hurt if you bashed someone over the head with it!

objects.ground: A candle rolls on the ground.

extras.text: This candle is made of uncolored wax, with a cotton wick. Very standard.

objects.ground: A folded pile of beige wool lies here.

extras.text: This homespun wool shirt has been dyed a rich shade of beige, almost the color of camel hide.

objects.ground: A dark brown wrap's hung on a peg.

extras.text: You see a dark brown expanse of homespun woolen cloth.  Simple in its cut and design, this garment would keep the worst of the weather off you.

objects.short: an insignia ring from the Academy
objects.ground: A small ring with an insignia on it lies here.

extras.text: You see some trainee's class ring.  Made of simple silver, it's decorated with the Ice Warrior insignia: a polar bear with a green-and-blue banner in its mouth.

objects.ground: Delicate lace mesh mitts are getting dirty on the ground.

extras.text: Obviously made with agility in mind, these mitts are a compromise between the need to cover one's hands and the need to still be able to use one's sense of touch.  The lace mesh seems hand-knitted.

objects.short: a nice warm pair of winter boots
objects.ground: A nice pair of warm boots rest here.

extras.text: These warm boots are made of thick leather with the fur side facing inward.  A thong ties each one shut at the top, keeping warmth inside.

objects.ground: A small wooden shield lies here.

extras.text: This shield isn't much bigger than your hand, and it's in pretty bad shape, with nicks and dents covering its wooden surface.  The insignia of the Ice Warriors adorns its front -- a polar bear gripping a green- and-gold banner in its mouth.

objects.ground: A warm-looking knitted cap lies here.

extras.text: You behold a simple knitted tuque that resembles a very large and wide sock. It's made of undyed wool.

objects.ground: Some fur armbands lie here getting dirty.

extras.text: You see some white fur armbands that would tie onto your upper arms by means of leather thongs.

objects.short: a pair of dark grey wool pants
objects.ground: A pair of warm-looking wool pants lies here.

extras.text: You see a simple pair of homespun woolen pants.  The garment's been dyed a dark grey color.  They seem very utilitarian.

objects.ground: A leather belt pouch lies here on the ground.

extras.text: This leather belt has a cloth pouch attached to it.  The belt's buckle is engraved with the insignia of the Ice Warrior Academy near Ickle -- a polar bear gripping a green-and-gold banner in its mouth.

objects.ground: A little eyebrow ring has been ripped out of someone's face!
A short, squat glass bottle sits here.

extras.text: It's a short, round bottle blown from sturdy glass.  A small paper label pasted on one side reads BOAKA.

objects.ground: A key carved into a cross topped by a circle lies here.

extras.text: The key is carved with the universal symbol for woman: A cross, topped with a circle. You wonder why on earth someone would carve a key like this.

objects.ground: A key made of purple amethyst lies here.

extras.text: This key is, amazingly, carved from a solid piece of crystal clear amethyst stone. It must open an equally opulent door.

rooms.name: An Icy Path
rooms.description: The ground crunches underfoot.  You're freezing cold and the sound just seems to make the cold worse.  You can barely struggle along this path, near the city of Ickle.  You hear some kind of movement to the north, and see the smoke of fires, and it occurs to you that there might be some people up ahead.

North.description: The pathway starts here and goes to the north.

South.description: You see a primitive road to the south.

rooms.name: An Icy Path
rooms.description: The path is difficult to maintain footing on.  You can barely tell that it is a path, what with having to squint against the freezing wind and drizzle. But the noise to the north is encouraging.  You might find somewhere warm in all this frozen land.

North.description: The well-worn path goes north from here.

South.description: You can leave the compound by going south.

rooms.name: An Icy Path
rooms.description: You're beginning to doubt the evidence of your senses about this trail. You must be seeing things.  That can't possibly be fresh blood spilled on the path.  But the drops seem as telling as any voice.  Someone fought here, or bled while fleeing through here.  What is this place?

North.description: The path continues to the north.

South.description: You can leave the compound by going south.

rooms.name: An Icy Path
rooms.description: You struggle against the wind, which is incredibly strong, and even more incredibly cold.  Your feet slip and slide along the icy, pebbly path, and when you look around, the bleakness of the landscape amazes you, even in this land of frost and cold.  You can't decide which way to go.

North.description: An intersection of sorts is to the north.

South.description: The path out of here goes southward.

rooms.name: A Turn in the Icy Path
rooms.description: The path seems to end here.  At least, it loses its pure ice quality and seems to become merely a very gravelly path.  It bends here, and now you can see some fields to the north, and some buildings.  There is indeed a camp of sorts here.  Since it's so close to Ickle, you think that it is somehow associated with that village, but at this point you don't know what purpose the camp has.  You can go west or south from here on the path.

North.description: You can leave the path and tramp through the snow, if you like.

South.description: The icy path continues to the south.

West.description: With wind biting at your skin, you squint west and see the path continuing.

rooms.name: A Gravelly Path
rooms.description: Here, at last, the footing is slightly better!  You aren't in active danger of falling and making a fool of yourself, or worse yet, hurting yourself.  But someone has obviously been hurt here.  You can see bloodstains on the small stones of the pathway.

North.description: You could leave the path and tramp through the snow, if you like.

East.description: You see a turn in the path to your east.

West.description: The gravelly path is visible to the west.

rooms.name: A Turn in the Gravelly Path
rooms.description: The path is lightly flecked with gravel to improve footing in the punishingly cold snow that shrouds everything you see.  The compound, because that's what it must be, is littered with blood and broken weapons.  Now that you understand that you're in a military encampment, you see why the blood is everywhere -- some great battle must have been fought.  The path goes north and east from here.

North.description: The path continues northward. Something smells good!

East.description: The path continues to the east.

rooms.name: A Gravelly Path
rooms.description: The pebbles crunch underfoot as you move here.  You smell something delicious coming from the structure up ahead to the north.  Other than that, you can see various other buildings scattered around to the north and east. You debate staying on the path or going to the snowy fields all around.  The path itself goes north and south of here.

North.description: You see an entrance to a building up ahead-- and boy, are you hungry!

East.description: You could leave the path and go tramping through the snow, if you'd like.

South.description: The path curves out of sight to the south.

rooms.name: An Entrance
rooms.description: You stand before a large structure that is clearly a rather permanent tent. The gravel underfoot crunches while you shift from foot to foot, unsure which way to go.  The building has caught your interest, principally because the delicious smells you've been catching come directly from it.  The building is a forbiddingly dank beige color.  You are suddenly unsure if you want to go into it.

North.description: The path continues to the north. You think you see another entrance.

East.description: You could leave the path and go through the snow, if you'd rather.

South.description: The path continues to the south.

West.description: You smell something utterly delicious coming from the west. Hungry yet?

extras.text: The sign tacked above the entrance to the tent says: ^ / \ /   \ /     \ ----------------------------------- /            MESS HALL             / /  ENTER ONLY AT AUTHORIZED TIMES  / /           WITH YOUR TROOP        / -----------------------------------

rooms.name: An Entranceway
rooms.description: You stand at what is clearly a crossroads of some kind.  To your east, you see a huge tent that seems sturdier than the rest.  It's also the biggest tent you've ever seen, reaching into the skies in height, and longer than you can see through this blizzard.  The path seems to end to the north, and begin as a slightly less gravelly path, more temporary-feeling.  You can't see much beyond that.  You can reach out with your hand and touch the tent whose entrance is to the south, but there's no way into it.

North.description: A gravelly path begins to the north.

East.description: You can't see much through the tentflap, but you can hear a lot of noise in there!

South.description: The path continues to the south. You see an entrance there.

rooms.name: The Entrance to the Mess Hall
rooms.description: Well!  You know immediately that this must be a mess hall, from the moment you walk into it!  You've definitely seen this kind of place before--bustling with activity, and the smells and signs of food.  This particular part of the tent goes only to the north, and in fact cordons prevent you from going to the rest of the hall.  You stand there, amazed at the intelligence of whoever leads this army.  The level of organization is superb.  You can go north, as the cordons seem to demand, or leave to the east.

North.description: You can see some lines painted on the ground that point to the north.

East.description: Outside, in the whistling wind, you see a gravelly path.

rooms.name: The Dining Room
rooms.description: You stand in the southern part of the mess hall.  Tables line this part of the hall, mostly clean, but occasionally scattered with trays and bits of food. Overall, however, the room seems to scream organization and bureaucracy.  You can go only north from here, even though you can see the entire tent.

North.description: You see the serving line to the north.

rooms.name: The Pantry
rooms.description: Your fingers fumble for light, but the thin sunshine coming through the tent's seams barely illumines the crowded room.  Rows of shelves cram every wall.  Sacks of what seem to be potatoes and other root vegetables are stacked in one corner.  Sausages and braids of garlic hang from the ceiling.  Jars of canned food are jammed into the shelves.  A notepad with a pencil attached to it dangles from a nail set into a tent post.

North.description: You see light to the north!

extras.text: It's a little notepad of thin beige paper backed by a bit of hardwood. Someone has thoughtfully tied a pencil to the top of the pad so it can be used readily. As you open the notepad's cover and look at it, you see that it appears to be a grocery list.

rooms.name: The Kitchen
rooms.description: Stoves, steam, and noise -- these are your initial impressions.  The Compound cooks must be busy people.  You had no idea feeding hundreds of people was this difficult.  The several stoves are packed with pots of cooking food. The ovens all have pans of meat and bread in them.  The room is much warmer than anywhere else in the Compound.  You wish you could just stay here.

North.description: The kitchen area extends to the north.

East.description: The kitchen ends to the east, where the serving line begins.

South.description: It's dark to the south. You can't tell what's in there.

rooms.name: The Serving Line
rooms.description: The line's advanced to a line of tables loaded with food.  The meal doesn't look terribly edible even to you, an adventurer, but you imagine soldiers would eat it happily enough.  You can go north or south to where the soldiers eat their rations, east to leave the tent, or west to the kitchens.

North.description: You see a lot of tables to the north.

East.description: You see a waiting area to the east.

South.description: You see a lot of tables to the south.

West.description: The serving line ends to the west, in a giant kitchen.

rooms.name: The Beginning of the Mess Hall Line
rooms.description: The line for food begins here!  The tent is huge, and while you're standing here, you marvel at the level of organization this mess hall indicates.  The tent's warm, at least, a nice change from the snow blowing outside.

South.description: The mess hall's entrance is clearly visible to the south.

West.description: Something smells fantastic to the west!

rooms.name: The Mess Hall Prep Room
rooms.description: This is a small room devoted to preparing the food from the kitchens for serving.  Serving spoons are hung by short tethers to pegs set into the tent pegs.  Tray heaters are stacked on one table, small candle heaters on another. You can go only south from here.

South.description: You see the kitchen to the south.

rooms.name: The Dining Room
rooms.description: You wander into a part of the tent line with tables.  The tables are arranged in tidy lines, and are mostly cleared.  Some of the tables have little trays of condiments in them.

South.description: You see the serving line to the south.

extras.text: They look just like the trays the soldiers put their food on as they go through the mess line, but instead of food, they have jars and shakers of various kinds of condiments on them. All of them smell funny.

rooms.name: The Back Entrance to the Arena
rooms.description: This is clearly a back entrance.  Thraja's compound, by and large, is tidy and neat, but here someone seems to have slipped up a little.  The dirt floor hasn't been swept in a while, and you see bits of food and occasional boot buckles pushed against the corner.  The arena tent is quite large, almost a building, but you can feel how empty it must be.  You can go east or west here.

East.description: The huge arena's entrance hallway continues to the east.

West.description: You can slip past the tent and get outside to the west if you like.

rooms.name: The Arena Hallway (West)
rooms.description: The dirt floor, so welcome after the cold and snow outside, hasn't been swept in a long time, and it's dark inside, dimly lit only by occasional cracks in the huge tent's seams.  You can go north or west.

West.description: The hallway ends to the west.

rooms.name: Holding Cell 1
rooms.description: It's dark in here!  You trip and fall into the slimiest dirt you have ever had the misfortune to encounter.  What's making it that slimy?  -- You don't even want to think about it.  The worst part about being here is...  You aren't at all sure there's any way out.

North.description: The only exit you can find goes to the north-- a heavy wooden door with a rusted-out lock.

rooms.name: Holding Cell 2
rooms.description: This must be where Commander Thraja's soldiers throw the worst prisoners, to await final judgment in the arena!  The ground is slippery with muck; you could swear you hear the soft patter of tiny feet all around you.  You can imagine the whole room is dotted with tiny eyes, all watching you, waiting for a chance to spring...

North.description: The only exit you can find goes to the north-- a heavy wooden door with a rusted-out lock.

rooms.name: Holding Cell 3
rooms.description: Your vision is quite limited in this tiny, cramped, dark room.  It smells absolutely horrible, and for once you're glad you can't see that well.  The door is heavy and doesn't open at your gentle push.  You are not at all liking the idea of searching these grimy, slimy walls for another entrance.  The soft sounds of animal life seem to ensure that you won't even try.

North.description: The only exit you can find goes to the north-- a heavy wooden door with a rusted-out lock.

rooms.name: The Main Entrance to the Arena
rooms.description: The narrow entranceway belies the hugest tent you have ever seen!  The roof of it stretches far overhead, supported by poles as thick as tree trunks -- in fact, they probably are cut from Frost Valley's rhell trees.  The floor is cleanly swept and free of extraneous litter.  Overall, you're impressed with the cleanliness, despite the pervasive scent of male sweat, pheremones, and blood.  You can go north, or east to leave.

North.description: A hallway begins to the north.

East.description: You can leave by way of a tentflap to the east.

rooms.name: Arena Steps
rooms.description: The steps are wooden, rickety, and obviously portable.  You can go up them to get a good seat in the audience boxes near the top of the tent.  When you put a foot out onto the first step, you feel it wobble.  Is it such a good idea to continue?

East.description: You see a large, spacious part of the tent to the east.

Up.description: Upward, you see a long row of seats facing the arena to your east.

rooms.name: The Arena
rooms.description: Your heart races involuntarily when you step onto the gravel of the arena pit-- probably because of the air, thick with pheremones and sweat and the odor of fear and excitement.  The audience pit is to your north, raised a little so everyone gets a good view of the combatants fighting or practicing at the moment.  There's enough room down here for several fights to be going on at the same time.  You can go only east or west here.

East.description: The arena continues to the west.

South.description: A heavy wooden door stands here. You can't open it!

West.description: A hallway begins to the west.

rooms.name: The Arena
rooms.description: The arena!  Your feet crunch on gravel as you walk across its surface.  The footing is excellent, though, and you walk in the semidarkness, admiring the huge tent, and its craftmanship.  You can't see much of the tent's roof, since it's so high above your head, but the huge timber logs holding it up are impressive enough to satisfy you.  You can go only east or west.

East.description: The arena continues to the east.

South.description: A darkened room lies behind this heavy wooden door...

West.description: The arena continues to the west.

rooms.name: The Arena
rooms.description: You can easily imagine the crowd that would be watching combatants in this huge arena.  Most likely, several fights would be occurring at once, or perhaps melees are staged, every person for himself, in a huge brawl.  The audience area is raised and rather large, but inaccessible from here.  You can head east or west from here, that's all.

East.description: A hallway begins to the east.

South.description: A darkened room lies behind this heavy wooden door...

West.description: The arena continues to the west.

rooms.name: The Arena Hallway (East)
rooms.description: The hallway is dark and you're glad that the floor is even, providing some kind of footing.  You can sense, rather than see, the rickety wooden stairs that head up, into further darkness.  Or you can continue on into the arena itself, to the west.  Or you can leave, to the south.

South.description: You see an entryway to the south.

West.description: A large expanse of space begins to the west.

Up.description: Up these steps, you see the arena audience seating.

rooms.name: Arena Audience Seating
rooms.description: This part of the audience area is composed of long benches, with aisles between them so people can move around more or less freely.  It's swept clean, except for a few bones and crusts of bread in the corners, making the entire auditorium smell like yesterday's lunch.  You look out, and see the arena below you, very clearly visible from here.  You can go east to see more of the auditorium, or down again.

East.description: The audience section continues to the east.

Down.description: You can go down these steps to leave the audience section.

rooms.name: Arena Audience Seating
rooms.description: This part of the auditorium is spacious, with several rows of wooden benches raised on tiers.  You imagine you'd have an excellent view of the arena below, from almost any point in this part of the tent.  You're amazed at how this huge tent can support such weight.  You can go only east or west.

East.description: The arena audience seating continues to the east.

West.description: The arena audience seating continues to the west.

rooms.name: Arena Audience Seating
rooms.description: The light from the seams in the tent barely illumines the long benches set up all along this auditorium.  The floor is well-swept, even in the tent corners.  You're impressed with the size and cleanliness of this tent. Soldiers where you're from wouldn't be so tidy.  You can go down the wooden stairs from here, or west, to the rest of the auditorium.

West.description: Audience seating continues to the west.

Down.description: Down the steps, a hallway is almost visible.

rooms.name: A Short Path
rooms.description: This path is short, but established looking.  You are awed by the size of the tents to the north and south; they're much larger than the camping tents you're familiar with.  You can go north, entering a tent, or east or west into snowy fields.

North.description: A large tent stands to your north.

East.description: A narrow alleyway begins to the east.

West.description: A snowy field begins to the west.

rooms.name: The Officers' Tent Order Room
rooms.description: As you enter this part of the tent, you realize it must be where the officers of the compound give orders to their key soldiers.  A large table dominates this part of the tent.  As you lean over the table, you see that it has a map on it.  You can go north or east from here

North.description: You see a lot of shiny glints in the semidarkness.

East.description: You see a lot of coats to the east.

extras.text: You examine the map on the table closely, and see that it's of this area, the frozen mountains. Very small amber counters are grouped all over the map, as are similar green glass counters. You wonder what it means. There are a lot of amber counters over the town of Ickle.

rooms.name: The Officers' Tent Foyer
rooms.description: When you enter this tent, it's quickly obvious that it must belong to the officers of this compound.  For starters, the tent itself is much larger than an ordinary soldier's tent, and of much higher quality material.  The seams are stitched closer together, allowing less light into the tent, and making the tent itself more cold- and water-resistant.  You know it's large, but you can't tell how large, because a divider runs just north of you, cutting off your view of much of the rest of the tent.  You can leave to the south, or go west from here.

South.description: You can leave this huge tent to the south.

West.description: A chalkboard and a small table are visible to the west.

rooms.name: The Officers' Sleeping Quarters
rooms.description: You are in a part of the tent reserved for officers' sleeping quarters. Cots and bunk beds take up most of this cramped space.  The beds are all neatly made, though, and no personal items are evident at first glance.  This entire tent is so clean you could eat off the floor.  This Thraja must keep excellent discipline over those she trains.

North.description: North, you see more bunks and cots.

rooms.name: The Officers' Armor Reserve
rooms.description: Large clay urns bristle with swords, some with pikes and spears, all very neatly arranged, like dangerous flowers.  You pick your way through this narrow hall in the tent, bumping against breastplates.  You can look up and see helmets dangling from cords from the tent's roofpoles.  All the weapons and armor are similarly made, and utilitarian to the utmost, bespeaking more of a concern for usefulness than ornamentation.  You can go east, through a curtain, or south from here.

East.description: A curtain obscures your view of the east end of the tent.

South.description: A blackboard and a small table take up what you can see of the southern end of the tent.

rooms.name: The Officers' Private Meeting Room
rooms.description: You find yourself jammed into what looks like a closet, with a small table, some chairs, and not much else crammed into this small cubbyhole.  This must be some kind of meeting room, you surmise.  A curtain obscures the western and southern end of the room, leaving your vision unveiled only to the east.

East.description: A few cots and chairs catch your eye when you look eastward.

West.description: A curtain obscures your view of the west.

rooms.name: The Officers' Rec Room
rooms.description: Finally, you've found the officers' relaxation area!  But it's not very large.  In fact, it's little more than a soft couch that you could easily sink into and fall asleep in, and a gameboard of some kind.  You see a boxful of pieces, but don't know what the game is, or what the pieces signify-- black and white round flat stones, in separate pots.  You can go south or west from here.

South.description: Some made-up cots occupy the southern end of the tent.

West.description: A table takes up most of the small alcove to the west.

extras.text: The gameboard is made of wood, its grain beautifully polished and stained to display the wood to its best advantage. The criss-crossing lines make perfect squares across its surface in a 19x19 grid. The pots are made of dark red hardwood, polished till they are smooth as glass, and lightly stained. The black stones feel pleasantly grainy, though they are polished as well. The white stones are thick polished shell, striations all across their marble-like surface. Whoever owns this game must feel like a king.

rooms.name: The Short Path
rooms.description: You're in the northeastern part of the compound now.  The mountains invade here, making it impossible to go to the south.  You can go north, to a field that's cleared away, or west to a huge tent, or east to another tent.

North.description: You can leave the path and head for the Northern Snowfield, if you wish.

East.description: The path continues to the east.

West.description: You can enter the huge tent to the west by way of a tentflap that stands open.

rooms.name: The Short Path
rooms.description: This path is just a few feet long, just long enough to provide a walkway between the two tents to your east and west.  Or you can go north to the fields.  South, however, is impassable, due to the rocky crags of the encroaching mountains.

North.description: A snowfield begins to the north.

East.description: You can enter this tent to the east, if you like.

West.description: The path continues to the west.

rooms.name: The Soldiers' Dormitory Entrance
rooms.description: As soon as you walk in, you see that it's rather dimly lit in here.  It's also quiet, with almost no soldiers inside it.  The tent is large, one of those semi-permanent structures you've seen in other parts of the compound.  A heavy curtain blocks your view of the northern part of the tent, though you can go east.

East.description: The dormitory continues to the east.

West.description: A tentflap obscures your view of outside.

rooms.name: The Soldiers' Dormitory Rec Room
rooms.description: Commander Thraja obviously spared every expense in giving her soldiers a nice, restful environment in which to relax and enjoy their free time.  This little niche is small, cramped, and cluttered with soldier-type debris: magazines, bags of dice, playing cards, and other paraphenelia.  A leaflet blows on one table.  You can go north or west from here.

North.description: You see lots of beds to the north.

West.description: The dormitory entrance lies westward.

extras.text: The leaflet appears to be a religious tract. It reads: ----------------------------------------- |            MIELIKKI LOVES YOU!         | |          Join the army of good         | |          and march against the         | |            forces of E V I L           | |                                        | |         JOIN THE POLAR GUARD NOW       | |            Go to exotic places         | |          Meet interesting people       | |              And kill them!            | |                                        | |     Mayhem!           Free training!   | |    Uniforms!            Good food!     | |                                        | |       Recruitment Office in Ickle      | |                                        | |               GO POLARS!               | |                                        | ------------------------------------------ You notice that someone has obviously used this leaflet for darts practice.

rooms.name: The Soldiers' Dormitory
rooms.description: Bunk beds are stacked three-deep along the walls, with two aisles of bunks in the middle of the room.  The bunks are made of metal bars, with thin pallets on each wire-ring bedsprings.  It doesn't look very comfortable, or even very restful.  You can head north or east from here.

North.description: Steam rises from some source to the north.

East.description: You see a lot of beds to the east.

rooms.name: The Soldiers' Dormitory
rooms.description: This is the other half of the dormitory.  Bunk beds are piled everywhere there's room.  Between here and the other part of the tent, you estimate that at one time there were a couple hundred soldiers here.  You wonder where they all went.  Training, probably.

North.description: A door set into the north partition doesn't seem to respond to your attempts to open it. A symbol is etched into the door.

South.description: You can go south to look at all the pretty couches, if you like.

West.description: You see some beds to the west.

extras.text: The door is surprisingly heavy for such a tent. On it, etched and burned into its surface, you see: ***** **     ** **       ** **     ** ***** * * ******* * * *

rooms.name: The Shower Room
rooms.description: This closed-off part of the dormitory contains what are clearly shower stalls-- small, enclosed cubicles with shower heads above them.  A tank of water stands nearby, and a pump shows how the soldiers got their morning showers.  But you don't notice any heaters.  These soldiers must be tough indeed, to be used to cold showers in the middle of snowfields!

North.description: The dormitory exit is to your north, past a curtain.

South.description: You see a lot of beds to the south.

rooms.name: The Women's Dormitory
rooms.description: Obviously, women train here as well, though to what capacity you can't ascertain for certain from just looking around.  All in all, you count twenty bunks, and they look exactly and precisely like those for the menfolk of the compound: Three high, and six or seven stacks of them lined up around the room.

North.description: A dressing area is visible to the north.

South.description: You see a heavy wooden door to the south.

extras.text: It has a tiny inscription near the bottom hinge that says "Artemis, copyright 1996".

rooms.name: The Soldiers' Dormitory North Entrance
rooms.description: This alcove is small, with a tent blocking your view of the eastern end of the tent.  From here you can see the shower room, and beyond, bunk beds.

North.description: You can leave the tent to the north by way of a door.

South.description: The dormitory continues to the south, past some clouds of steam.

rooms.name: The Women's Dressing Room
rooms.description: Two shower stalls are off to the left.  To the right are some long benches. Some lockers line the walls, but they're all, well, locked.  You can't see anything prurient, even though this is the women's part of the dormitory. Maybe these women aren't just cooks.  But where are they all?

South.description: You see the women's sleeping area to the south.

rooms.name: A Paved Path
rooms.description: You must be somewhere near the center of command-- this path is professionally paved.  Even the snow is pushed away from the path, to make a neatly manicured appearance.  You can go south, to a tent, or north or west to the path.

North.description: The beautifully paved path continues to the north.

South.description: A door bars your way to the south.

West.description: The paved path continues to the west, toward a medium-sized tent.

rooms.name: A Paved Path
rooms.description: How inexplicable....  This path, in marked contrast to paths elsewhere in the Compound, is carefully paved with a hard, grey material.  The paving makes it easy to walk, and you count your blessings as you wander through here.  To your north rises an opulent tent, so sturdily built it could be a building of its own.

North.description: A door bars your way to the north. A beautifully worked purple gemstone lock keeps the door closed.

South.description: The paved path continues to the south.

rooms.name: The Commander's Tent Entrance
rooms.description: This is one luxurious tent!  At first, you resent Commander Thraja, even before you've met her, for living in such luxury while denying her troops decent comfort.  But then you start noticing things: The furnishings are austere, the walls have no tapestries or ornamentation, and there are no personal possessions in view.  Even the least touch of beauty is missing from this tent.  It's large, but you slowly get the feeling that even this small luxury was forced upon the commander.

North.description: You smell incense to the north.

East.description: A receiving room is set up the the east.

South.description: A door blocks your view of the south. An amethyst lock is set into the middle of the door.

rooms.name: The Commander's Receiving Room
rooms.description: Here is where Commander Thraja entertains her infrequent guests and gives orders to her commanding officers.  None of her personality seems to come through in this sparsely furnished nook: the chairs aren't very comfortable, or very thickly padded, and the table is plain, oil-finished wood, with nothing visible on it or under it.  Perhaps this austerity is necessary to keep the officials of the nearby arctic village, Ickle, from questioning the activities of the compound.  A curtain separates you from where Thraja takes her rest.

North.description: The Commander's bed is visible to the north, through a curtain.

West.description: The entrance lies westward.

rooms.name: The Commander's Scrying Room
rooms.description: This part of the tent is filled with occult paraphernalia, all along the walls, and on a three-tier bookshelf.  A shiver creeps up your spine as you look around.  A tiny monster's head floats in a jar on the shelf, next to a grimoire whose spine is written in red-brown ink.  Incense burns in a little cone-shaped brass holder, but it's the only pleasant thing in here.  None of this makes sense.  Why would the commander, who by all appearances is a no-nonsense woman, indulge in magic of any kind?  Perhaps she, like any commander before a hopeless engagement, takes any advantage she can, even if she's skeptical.  Or maybe it's all forced upon her by her benefactor's.  A curtain hanging to the east obscures what you're sure is the commander's bedroom.

North.description: Some chairs and settees are arranged around a small table to the north.

East.description: A beautifully carved bed is barely visible to the south, past a curtain.

South.description: The entranceway is visible to the south.

rooms.name: The Commander's Bedroom
rooms.description: The curtain falls away to reveal a beautifully simple wooden slat bed with a thin pallet on it.  The standard-issue blankets cover a small pillow.  Nothing else is in here, except a small bedside stand.  The drawers pull out to reveal some papers written in a foreign language you can't understand.  Strangely, when you go to leave, you discover you can't.  The curtain is magically empowered and won't let you past.

West.description: The beautiful painting on the wall is all you can see here.

extras.text: The painting depicts a beautiful woman of indeterminate age. Her skin is as pale as moonlight, but her eyes are unnaturally indigo-black. Her full lips are shell-pink. She wears a crimson robe lined in ermine and a silver circlet that holds her long white hair back. She looks very cruel, though you can't say for sure why you think that. She holds a mirror up to the viewer of the painting, and you're shocked to see that although the mirror is clearly painted, not an actual mirror, you see yourself in it!

rooms.name: The Commander's Dining Area
rooms.description: The small, round table seats two, perhaps three if they're good friends. The wooden surface of the table is nicked, as if knives have been buried in it before.  Maybe the commander person doesn't have great manners.

East.description: An easel with a picture on it stands in the corner to the east.

South.description: Some chairs are set up to the south.

rooms.name: The Commander's Private Study
rooms.description: A bookshelf of what looks like studies, maps, and war-type resources stands here, shielded from the world by a familiar-looking curtain.  A comfortable chair, incongruous in the midst of the rest of the spartan surroundings, faces a painting of a beautiful woman.

East.description: You think you can almost see something in this picture...

South.description: A beautiful bed is visible to the south.

West.description: The receiving room is visible to the west.

extras.text: The painting is masterfully done, so lifelike you could reach out and run your fingers down the pale cheek of the beautiful woman it depicts. She's neither young nor old, her skin like moonlight, her hair so pure white it glows, her features finely chiseled. Her eyes stand out in powerful contrast, being so dark indigo they're nearly black. She wears a beautiful dark blue dress that shimmers, with a crimson and ermine robe over it. She holds a silver mirror in her slender hands. You're shocked to see that although the mirror is painted, not an actual mirror, you can see your own reflection in it!

rooms.name: A Paved Path
rooms.description: This path is clearly for finer boots than yours!  It's paved almost professionally, with stones laid so well the surface of the path is smooth. You must be near some kind of elite part of the compound.

East.description: The paved path leads to the west, toward a narrow tent.

South.description: A small building is visible to the south.

West.description: The paved path ends to the west, in front of a long, narrow tent.

rooms.name: A Paved Path
rooms.description: This path is beautiful inlaid with smooth stone that is as grey as the mountains in the distance.  The path seems well-laid out, not random, like the paths elsewhere in the compound.  You wonder why the sudden change in style.

East.description: The paved path goes far to the east.

South.description: A snow-covered alleyway begins to the south.

West.description: A door marked with mystic symbols bars your entry to the west.

rooms.name: The Necromancer's Tent
rooms.description: The tent is dark, very dark.  You stumble through its clutter, hoping there aren't as many rats and bugs in here as the multidinous chittering, clicking sounds seem to indicate there are.  The air smells sickly-sweet, as if someone burned incense to cover a particularly bad smell.  You barely make out a small, cramped bed in one corner, the necromancer's one concession to human needs.

North.description: Sinister sounding chuckling is audible to the north.

East.description: A door marked with mysterious symbols separates the tent from the outside.

rooms.name: The Necromancer's Viewing Room
rooms.description: A pentegram is etched in the floor of the tent.  You strain your eyes to see, immediately regretting your ill-advised action when you see the obscene murals on the walls of the tent.  Demons, overlords, and monsters from your worst nightmares are depicted in living color.  As you wander the room, carefully avoiding the pentegram, of course, you make a real effort to keep your stomach's churning under control.

South.description: Past some bead curtains, you sense more incredible evil.

rooms.name: A Gravelly Path
rooms.description: The path changes character here from its southern origins.  It's packed down and gravel crunches underfoot, making footing slightly difficult.  The snow is filthy on the path, indicating the great numbers of people who've traversed this path lately.

North.description: You can barely make out some tents to the north.

East.description: The path ends and you can slog through snow to the east.

South.description: The path continues to the south.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Gravelly Path
rooms.description: The gravel moves underfoot, shifting as you tread on the path.  The path itself has a temporary, makeshift look, as if it were made in a big hurry and then never improved.

North.description: You can leave the path here and go into the snowy fields, if you'd like.

East.description: You can leave the path and go east into the snow, if you'd like.

South.description: The path goes southward.

West.description: You see an open tent to the west.

rooms.name: An Enlisted Warrior's Tent
rooms.description: You stumble into a spartan tent.  Clearly, this tent belongs to a "grunt" -- a frontline soldier.  It's small, but very neat.  The tentflaps are closed, keeping out the cold and wind on either side, and the cot is made up tightly.

North.description: The gravelly path ends to your north.

East.description: You can leave the nice warm tent to the east.

rooms.name: A Short Path Between Tents
rooms.description: The freezing wind lessens just a bit, and you see that you are now standing on a short section of stamped-down snow and ice.  The soldiers have erected tents here and there; they are almost invisible in the white snow.  You can enter a tent to the south or west, or head into the large snowy field to the north and east.

North.description: You can leave the path to the north.

East.description: You could leave the path for the snow, if you wanted!

South.description: You see an open tent to the south.

rooms.name: An Enlisted Warrior's Tent
rooms.description: As soon as you enter this tent, you are instantly struck by how warm it is in here.  In fact, you wish you could stay in here for a while, and perhaps thaw yourself out.  The soldier who owns this tent is obviously a very organized person; even the socks on his clothes shelf are folded into neat little roll shapes.  You had no idea the guards in the towns got such good training, but obviously they had to come from somewhere!  You can exit to the east or west.

East.description: You can leave the tent to the east.

West.description: You could leave the tent to the west.

rooms.name: An Enlisted Warrior's Tent
rooms.description: You enter a tent that is the home of one of Thraja's trainees-- and not a particularly neat soldier, either.  How did this one escape inspection?  The place looks like someone tossed a wind elemental in here!  Clothes litter the floor, you can't even see the sleeping cot, and a picture of a nude Ice Dancer is on the wall.  You shake your head.  At least it's warm.  You can go east or north from here.

North.description: You see a stamped-down path to the north.

East.description: Another tent opens to the east.

rooms.name: A Stamped-Down Path
rooms.description: You wonder how long the soldiers have been camped here.  This path certainly seems temporary.  It's only a few feet long, and there aren't many footprints in its barely-flat surface.  You can head north or south to another tent, or east to the field.

North.description: You see another tent to the north.

East.description: You can leave even this pathetically made path to go to the east.

South.description: You see another tent to the south.

rooms.name: An Enlisted Warrior's Tent
rooms.description: Inside, it's so warm you wish you could stay here forever!  You slip past the tentflap and into a small tent that's obviously home to a low-ranking soldier.  There aren't many personal effects in the room to tell much about its owner.  Perhaps this soldier is the shy type.  You can exit the tent to the east or south.

East.description: You see another tent to the east.

South.description: You see a makeshift path to the south.

rooms.name: The End of the Stamped-Down Path
rooms.description: This is it, the end of the line!  Perhaps Thraja wants to eventually put more tents here, perhaps build up security in this part of the compound a little more.  Perhaps some soldier was about to put a tent nearby, and at the last second was taken to another part of the compound.  Whatever the reason, the path ends here.  You can go into the snow to the east or south or to the last tent in the line to the west.

East.description: The north fields begin here, to the east.

South.description: The fields start to the south.

West.description: You see an open tent flap to the west.

rooms.name: A Snowy Field
rooms.description: This part of the field is wedged in between a pathway and one of the hugest tents you have ever seen.  Many footprints in the snow seem to indicate that this field isn't just for show -- it's a practice ground, of sorts, and perhaps used for recreation as well.  These soldiers must be blue-skinned, though, from the intense cold.  You can go north, further into the field, or west, to a pathway.

North.description: North seems to lead toward another part of this field.

West.description: You think the path takes up toward the west.

rooms.name: A Snowy Field
rooms.description: The cold is destroying your morale and your body, you just know it!  You trudge through this huge field, finding nothing to admire, and nothing to commend.  The only thing that seems good, in fact, is a warming sensation clearly felt when you face north.  The field continues to the north, east, and south, or you can flee to a path to the west.

North.description: You think it's getting warmer toward the north.

East.description: The field continues to the east.

South.description: The field continues to the south.

West.description: The trail begins to the west.

rooms.name: A Snowy Field
rooms.description: This corner of the field is snow-draped, all in white.  Here and there a twig breaks free of the snow, a bleak reminder that almost everything here is dead.  You can go north, toward a large tent, or west back into the cold.

North.description: The fields continue to the north. A building is visible further on.

West.description: The fields continue to the west.

extras.text: This is the biggest tent you've ever seen! It looks pretty permanent, as if it's been here for a while, and all signs seem to indicate that it'll be here a while longer. You wonder what its function is. Obviously it's important to the people who live here.

rooms.name: A Snowy Field
rooms.description: You blink into the sun's reflection off the field's white surface.  Your eyes hurt.  Still, you're awed by the beauty before you: The largest expanse of white you've seen in your life, bordered on the far northern side by a huge range of mountains.  It's beautiful, and almost worth your discomfort to see. Almost.  You can head north or east to the fields, or south or west to the pathway.

North.description: The field goes on to the north, and you think you see a mountain beyond them.

East.description: The air grows vaguely warmer to the east. You're freezing!

South.description: The path is vaguely visible to the south.

West.description: A path is visible to the west.

rooms.name: A Warm Fire
rooms.description: What's this?  A roaring fire beckons you closer.  The bonfire is huge, with flames a tall man's height, licking the cold air.  Raw, cut logs are embedded in the ground at a safe distance from the fire.  The snow is melting all around the fire; the circle of brown-and-green ends a short distance beyond the logs. You could rest here a short while, to get your breath and your warmth back, or you can venture out in all four directions into the snow fields.

North.description: Northward, the air gets colder. The fields continue.

East.description: Eastward, the air gets colder. The fields become a narrow snowy walkway.

South.description: Southward, the freezing fields continue.

West.description: The fields continue to the west.

extras.text: The fire is warm, lulling you to a half-sleep. You just want to curl up on one of these benches and watch the dancing flames. If it weren't for the warmth of this fire, you'd most likely drop dead of cold. No doubt someone else realized this too, and that's why it's here.

rooms.name: A Snowy Field
rooms.description: The field is narrower here, wedged in between two large tents.  The cold is unbearable.  You can go east, to a path that goes between the two buildings, or you can go south into the fields more, or you can go west to the bonfire. It's up to you.

East.description: The path narrows to the east.

South.description: The path ends in a corner to the south.

West.description: You think it's getting warmer to the west.

rooms.name: A Corner Near the Soldiers' Tents
rooms.description: You step into a snowy field wedged into the curve of a path that connects the soldiers' tents.  It's freezing here, and your feet sink right into the snow, making footing difficult, if not almost impossible.  You can go north or west to the path itself, or east, further into the field.

North.description: A stamped-down path is visible to the north.

East.description: The northern fields continue to the east.

West.description: You see a path to the west.

rooms.name: A Snowy Field
rooms.description: You're standing in the middle of a large snow-covered field.  You suppose it's used for training exercises or recreation, since numerous footprints in its surface attest to its frequent use.  Your feet, however, sink into the snow, making footing impossible.  You could trudge to the north, east, or west, through more snow, or go south to a path.

North.description: The fields seem to end to the north.

East.description: The northern fields continue to the east.

South.description: You see a path to the south that might afford better footing than this field.

West.description: The fields trail off to the west.

rooms.name: A Snowy Field
rooms.description: You're in the dead center of a huge snow-covered field.  The cold drives through your clothes and armor, to your very bones, and the wind seems to push you in all kinds of different directions.  No matter which direction you look in, the snow goes on and on.

North.description: The fields seem to end to the north.

East.description: The northern fields continue to the east.

South.description: The fields continue to the south.

West.description: The fields go far to the west.

rooms.name: Up Against the Officers' Tent
rooms.description: The tent makes a kind of lee that you can huddle in, grateful for any respite from the wind and the cold.  A majestic mountain range is dimly visible to the north, rising above the field and high into the grey skies.

North.description: The fields end to the north, against another tent.

South.description: Is that a fire you see to the south?

West.description: The fields to far to the west.

rooms.name: Against the Mountains
rooms.description: You've never seen anything so majestic, so regal, so huge, or so stark as these grey mountains that seem to rise up like a giant fist into the heavens. There's no way you could get over, across or through these stone giants, so don't even bother trying.  The footprints go up to the mountains, but stop there and turn around toward the field.  You can west, to a path, or east or south to the field.

East.description: The fields against the mountains continue to the east a ways.

South.description: The northern fields continue a short ways to the south.

West.description: A poorly made, stamped down path begins to the west.

rooms.name: Against the Mountains
rooms.description: The beautiful mountains rise up immediately to the north, unpassable, and impenetrable.  You would do better to turn around, and explore these fields all around you.  You can go east, west, or south, to explore the fields.

East.description: The fields end against a building to the east.

South.description: The fields go a ways to the south.

West.description: The fields go a short distance to the west.

rooms.name: Against a Large Tent
rooms.description: You're in a corner created by the junction of a huge tent and the frozen mountains.  The wind has died somewhat here, allowing you to catch your breath, although the cold is still astonishing.  Every breath you take seems like a knife in your lungs.  You can go south or west across the fields.

South.description: The fields go far to the south.

West.description: The fields go a ways to the west.

rooms.name: The Northeast Snowfield
rooms.description: You're in a huge field, draped in soft snow, dotted with footprints.  The field must be used for training exercises.  The snow is thick, making the footing treacherous.

North.description: The air is warmer to the north.

East.description: The field continues to the east.

South.description: You see a path to the south.

rooms.name: The Northeast Snowfield
rooms.description: This corner of the snowfield butts up against a path and a tent.  The field continues to the north and west.  Your feet sink into the snow, making progress difficult.  Maybe you'd do better on that path to the south.

North.description: The field continues to the north.

South.description: A path is visible to the south.

West.description: The field continues to the west, bounded by a huge tent.

rooms.name: The Northeast Snowfield
rooms.description: This part of the field juts against a huge tent whose peaks reach up to the sky.  You squint into the sky, trying to make out the size of the tent, but you can't.  It's absolutely freezing.

North.description: The field continues to the north.

East.description: It's getting warm to the east. Maybe you should go that way.

rooms.name: The Eastern Fire
rooms.description: The blizzard seems to lift just enough for you to make out a light ahead. When you stumble toward it, you see that it's a bonfire.  It's a large bonfire, with logs arranged in a circle around it at a safe distance.  You suppose this is a resting area for soldiers who are practicing or playing in the incredible cold.

North.description: The field continues to the north, and beyond that, you see an opulent tent.

East.description: The field continues to the east, bounded by a large tent.

South.description: The field goes on to the south, and beyond that, a path. The mountains claim everything else.

West.description: The field ends in a corner to the west.

rooms.name: Up Against the Dormitories
rooms.description: The snow is piled up against the tent to your immediate east, and so thick your feet sink right through it.  The cold is going clean through your all-too-meager clothing; the wind alone is horrendous.  You can go north, south, or west, though the tent you're next to seems impenetrable from here.

North.description: A small building stands to the north.

South.description: The field continues to the south.

West.description: It's getting warm to the west. Maybe you should go that way?

rooms.name: The End of the Snowy Alleyway
rooms.description: The path to the west spills into this part of a very narrow field, which forms an alley between three tents.  You trudge through this part of the alley, looking with awe at the huge tent to the south, the luxurious tent to the north, and the small, narrow tent to the northwest.

East.description: The alleyway continues to the east.

West.description: A short path begins to the west, connecting two huge tents.

rooms.name: A Narrow Snowy Alley
rooms.description: This tiny alleyway wedges between several tents in all directions.  The snow is thick, and dotted with footprints--evidently people have been using this alley as a shortcut for a while.  The blizzard's snow is beginning to fill in the prints.  You can only go east or west.  To your south, a large tent blocks your path.  To the north, the craggy mountains have made passage impossible.

East.description: The snowy alley continues to the east.

West.description: The alley seems to end to the west.

rooms.name: A Narrow Snowy Alley
rooms.description: This end of the alleyway between the tents is thick with old snow. Someone's obviously made an effort to tidy up here, since snow is piled against the wall of the tent to the north.  But the new falling snow is rendering that effort futile.

East.description: The field starts to the east.

South.description: The northeastern field continues to the south.

West.description: The snowy alley continues to the west.

rooms.name: The Northeast Snowfield
rooms.description: You're standing in the northernmost part of this field.  The snow is thick here, soaking through your shoes and clothes.  The mountains to the north seem very tall, grey with snow.  Freestanding tents of various sizes lie in all directions.

North.description: A pathway begins to the north.

East.description: A small building stands to the east. What is it?

South.description: You can see a fire to the south. Hopefully it's under control.

West.description: A snowy passageway begins to the west.

rooms.name: A Guard Station
rooms.description: This corner of the field has a small building in it.  The building is just large enough for an unfortunate guard to stand in it and gain some kind of shelter from the freezing wind and bitter cold.  The white-painted wooden building, you reason, must exist right here to protect some high-ranking member of Thraja's school.  Or perhaps several such members.

North.description: You can go north, to a pathway.

South.description: A snowfield begins to the south.

West.description: The snowfield bounds a path to the west.

rooms.name: The Southern Snowfield
rooms.description: You enter the southwestern corner of a large snow covered field.  It's obvious that the soldiers of this compound use this field for training and recreation, since there are far more footprints here than you'd expect of a purely decorative field.  The snow is thick and it's hard to walk through it. You can to south or west to the path, or north or east to explore the fields more.

North.description: The field continues to the north.

East.description: The field continues to the east.

South.description: A path is visible to the south.

West.description: A path is visible to the west.

rooms.name: The Southern Snowfield
rooms.description: You're standing in the southeastern corner of a huge field that faces the entire Compound.  The snow blankets everything in a soft white shroud.  The east is impenetrable, due to the jagged crags of the mountains that are all around this compound, but you can go south, north, or west.

North.description: The field seems to come to an end to the north.

South.description: A path begins to the south.

West.description: The path continues to the west.

rooms.name: The Southern Snowfield
rooms.description: You're now in the northwest corner of a snowfield that faces Commander Thraja's training compound.  The snowfield looks like it's used for various things-- recreation, training, who knows what else?  This corner of the field butts up against the biggest tent you've ever seen.  The field continues to the east and south, or you could go west to a path.

East.description: The field continues to the east.

South.description: The field continues to the south.

West.description: The path is visible to the west.

extras.text: This is the biggest tent you've ever seen! But where is everyone? This compound looks fairly large, but you haven't seen many soldiers here. Where are they all? Have you begun to think that something's wrong here?

rooms.name: The Southern Snowfield
rooms.description: The cold here is astonishing!  You start thinking that you'll die of cold. It seems to seep into your clothes and armor as if you were wearing nothing at all.  At least the wind seems to have abated somewhat, allowing you a chance to catch your breath and look around.  The snow is dotted with footprints that you didn't make, making you think it's not just an ornamental field.  To your north rises an impressively large tent.  The field goes on to the south and west.

South.description: The field continues to the south.

West.description: The field continues to the west.

extras.text: The tent is made of thick oiled cloth, and stretches far above your head to the immediate north. You wonder what it houses, but you can't seem to find any way into it from here.
